official-title.#text:
Commemorating President Gerald R. Ford and the invaluable impact of his service to the United
			 States in honor of the 40th anniversary of his Presidency.

Whereas on August 9, 1974, Vice President Gerald R. Ford takes the Oath of Office in the East Room

quote.#text:
In all my public and private acts as
			 your president, I expect to follow my instincts of openness and candor
			 with full confidence that honesty is always the best policy in the end. My
			 fellow Americans, our long, national nightmare is over.

Whereas on August 22, 1974, President Gerald R. Ford, along with First Lady Betty Ford, announces
			 his support for the Equal Rights Amendment;

Whereas Mrs. Ford is a strong proponent of the Equal Rights Amendment and actively joins in the
			 nationwide movement by speaking about women’s issues, lobbying

Whereas the following year, President Ford signs an Executive order establishing the National
			 Commission for the Observance of International Women’s Year (1975);

text.#text: Whereas appropriately, President Ford signs the

quote.#text:
Lying in the hospital, thinking of all those women going for cancer checkups because of me, I'd
			 come to recognize more clearly the power of the woman in the White House.
			 Not my power, but the power of the position, a power which could be used
			 to help.

the state of the Union is not good. Millions of

Whereas President Ford greets a planeload of orphans at San Francisco International Airport upon

Whereas on July 26, 1975, President Gerald R. Ford departs on a trip to Europe for visits to West
